definition: to sting or bite (of mosquito, bee etc)/to say repeatedly/to urge insistently/to ask repeatedly/to stick to a point/(onom.) tinkling or jingling sound

sentences.english: Then he heard a clanking noise deep down below .
sentences.chinese: 接着他聽見地下深處傳來一陣叮噹聲。

sentences.english: From brightly lit windows came the tinkle of laughter and the sound of singing.
sentences.chinese: 從明亮的窗戶傳來了笑聲叮噹聲和歌聲。

sentences.english: We heard clink come from that room.
sentences.chinese: 我們聽到那個屋子傳來叮噹聲。

sentences.english: He tinkled his coins together in his pocket.
sentences.chinese: 他使口袋中的硬幣碰在一起發出叮噹聲。

sentences.english: Do not punish me if you have not let me out for 3 hours and I tinkle .
sentences.chinese: 不懲罰我，如果你還沒有讓我出3個小時，我叮噹聲。

sentences.english: And if you listen closely, you can hear the tinkle of the rattle as you move.
sentences.chinese: 如果你側耳聆聽，你會聽見撥浪鼓搖動時的叮噹聲。

sentences.english: He dropped the nails on the ground and successive clangs were heard.
sentences.chinese: 他把釘子掉到了地上，聽見了一連串的叮噹聲。

sentences.english: The wind carries away in glee the tinkling of your anklet bells.
sentences.chinese: 風歡喜地帶走了你腳踝上的叮噹聲。

sentences.english: He drop ped the nails on the ground and successive clangs were heard.
sentences.chinese: 他把釘子掉到了地上，聽見了一連串的叮噹聲。
你是說那響得要命的叮噹聲？

sentences.english: The clang of the firebell alarmed the village.
sentences.chinese: 火警鈴的叮噹聲驚動了全村的人。

sentences.english: their jingling would drown thy whispers.
sentences.chinese: 它們的叮噹聲會淹沒你的低語。
